entry.title: North Wrestling â€œThe World At Largeâ€

link.title: North Wrestling â€œThe World At Largeâ€

entry.content:
Since itâ€™s birth on to the British wrestling scene back in 2016, North Wrestling has brought to us some of the best this business has to offer, whether that be home grown or international, thereâ€™s something for anyone which is why North has become a firm favourite to fans and wrestlers alike. Having been part of the incredible atmosphere, surrounded by these amazing people itâ€™s no wonder why this company is a fantastic night out at the Anarchy Brewery Co, Newcastle and always SOLD OUT.

So letâ€™s take a look at their fantastic â€œThe World At Largeâ€ event from 15th October!

Warhorse vs Jet Marshal

Straight off the bat we saw the strength of Warhorse as he was able to dictate the match in the early goingâ€™s with Jet fighting back at times. However when his leg was isolated he wasnâ€™t able to use that quick speed that we are very familiar with the focus moving to the outside when Warhorse performed a â€˜Sentonâ€™ through the middle ropes onto Jet and thus into the crowd. The action continued once back in the ring as Jet built up a fantastic comeback with two near falls and kicking out of the â€˜Elbow Drop of Deathâ€™ but it was too much for him when he finally tapped out of the â€˜Scorpion Deathlock of Deathâ€™.

Great opening match but unfortunately Warhorse used his strength and aggression to dominate the match and after, he took to the mic to give credit to Jet Marshal for stepping up and offering a fist bump as a mark of respect.

We saw footage of â€œThe Last True Sick Boyâ€ Rory Coyle getting taken out by Clint Margera which followed with the ULTRA VIOLENCE Champion himself, Rory Coyle coming to the ring to get something off his chest. As he was doing just that we had the pleasure of Zeo Knox & Benji aka The Landed Gentry come to the ring to a resounding boo. After Benji took to the mic to explain why he hates the champ an annoyed Rory stated that he has friends and weapons, inviting the BIGGEST weapon from the back to come out and join themâ€¦welcome Conor Renshaw but before he could even get in the ring, Screwface & Big Lou Nixon took them out with the sneak attack which prompted Crash Boat to come to the rescue and even the odds, ultimately resulting in an 8-Man Tag being announced.

Rory Coyle/Conor Renshaw/Crash Boat vs The Landed Gentry/Screwface/Big Lou Nixon

The action spilled out to ringside as soon as the bell rang for the match but it was â€˜Stunnerâ€™ galore in the early going as Conor hit his opponents one by one with the move to rally up the crowd which then saw each team take turns in dominating the match. As the end of the match drew near Benji used his Croquet mallet to the mid section of Coyle for the upper hand and as he was about to use the commemorative plate of his, â€œThe Sick Boyâ€ produced a video tape nasty of his very own, throwing a fireball to the face, resulting in him hitting a â€˜DDTâ€™ for the pin.

What were you expecting, it was a hard hitting match which descended into chaos with each team having their time to shine.

We then go to the backstage and see that Screwface & Big Lou Nixon have taken out Crash Boat.

Lana Austin w/ Isaiah Quinn vs Kasey Owens

Just before the match, Quinn decided to have a few words with Lana about her opponent for the night which resulted in Kasey coming to the ring and hitting â€œThe Queen of Meanâ€ with a couple of clotheslines but Lana was able to gain momentum with a sidestep resulting in Kasey getting caught up in the ring ropes and then dictating the match until she was hit with a devastating â€˜Death Valley Driverâ€™. However after Quinn got involved by grabbing the foot of Kasey that gave Lana the opportunity she needed, hitting her â€˜Roaring Elbowâ€™ and following it up with a â€˜Hangmanâ€™s DDTâ€™ for the win.

Both women are at their peak on the British wrestling scene and itâ€™s always a pleasure to see these two in the ring.

We went backstage to see Zeo Knox expressing his displeasure to Benji of loosing early that night and wants another plan for Northâ€™s next show. Itâ€™s Tag Team action next as Sunshine Machine challenge Boisterous Behaviour for the North Wrestling Tag Team Championshipâ€™s and we are graced by the â€œLyrical Dragonâ€ that is Man Like Dereiss & his tag team partner, Leon Slater.

Sunshine Machine vs Boisterous Behaviour (c)

The team of Mambo & Cooper took control from the off showing why they are one of the best on the wrestling scene with the champions doing whatever they can to sway the match in their favour but to no avail as the challengers continued to dictate. Until a â€˜Shooting Starâ€™ was reversed into a â€˜Cutterâ€™ followed up with a â€˜3Dâ€™. Dereiss then hit a â€˜Powerbombâ€™ to Mambo which was followed up by a â€˜450 Splashâ€™ from Slater but Mambo was able to get his knees upon time, holding Slater in place for Cooper to hit a Stomp. The finish came when both champs were able to hit a â€˜450 Splashâ€™ to Sunshine Machine for the win.

Fantastic match from start to finish as each one of these wrestlers are incredible in the ring and a delight to watch them perform their craft.

Isaiah Quinn then introduced us to the winner of the Lana/Kasey match which saw Lana thanking everyone but Quinn.

Kidd Bandit vs Will Kroos

Next we saw the debut of â€œThe Protagonist of Pro Wrestlingâ€ Kidd Bandit taking on â€œThe Headlineâ€ Will Kroos and before the match even started Bandit was unsure what theyâ€™d got themselves into but a bit of dutch courage came in the form of beer which was downed (in a couple of attempts) and not to be upstaged, Kroos would take up the challenge as well. Bandit tried their best to take control of the match from the beginning using some kicks to the mid section and speed but Kroos used his strength to turn the tide hitting some devastating clotheslines and throwing his opponent from one side of the ring to the other. However the momentum shifted in Banditâ€™s favour as they were able to reverse an â€˜Overhead Slamâ€™ into a â€˜DDTâ€™, followed up with a â€˜Superkickâ€™, then a â€˜Boomerang Kickâ€™, a â€˜Missile Dropkickâ€™ and finally a â€˜V-Triggerâ€™ but only for the two. Even a â€˜Spinal Tapâ€™ wasnâ€™t enough to keep the North Wrestling regular down. Somehow Bandit was able to kick out of a â€˜Sitdown Powerbombâ€™ but after each pulled out some fantastic reversals the finish came when Kroos hit the â€˜Kroosifixionâ€™ onto his opponent for the win.

Very good match with the â€œDavid vs Goliathâ€ layout as both had their time to shine and to be honest, no matter the outcome both were winners and the crowd loved it.

We hear from Boisterous Behaviour backstage offering a challenge to ANYONE across the globe to step-up to the North Wrestling Tag Team Champions.

Lizzy Evo vs Millie McKenzie

Someone the North Wrestling faithful love (maybe not) Lizzy returns to take on the debuting Millie McKenzie in what promises to be a belter of a match as both showed why they are just that good in the ring. Both didnâ€™t see any signs of slowing down as they attacked each other with lightning speed from the start. Evenly matched I didnâ€™t know which way this one would go as both brought their A game, giving each one time to shine and hitting some beautiful well timed moves which ended when McKenzie hit a â€˜Spearâ€™ to pick up the 3-count.

A fantastic match for two of the best the British wrestling scene has to offer.

We see a video looking at the rivalry that has become between former friends, HT Drake and Gene Munny.

Gene Munny vs HT Drake Itâ€™s Birthday time for HT Drake as he takes on former friend Gene Munny in what will be a fun filled match. We saw Gene using his â€œBad Boiâ€ image to help take advantage of the match in the early goings but HT Drake was able to shift the tide in his favour after reversing a â€˜Low Blowâ€™ attempt with a beautiful â€˜Butterfly Suplexâ€™ which also saw him kicking out of a belt shot to the face and Geneâ€™s â€˜Ainsley Lariatâ€™ but when Gene knocked the referee down he thought he had the win in the bag but when he hit the â€˜Low Blowâ€™ it didnâ€™t work as Drake was wearing a cup which he used to take out (literally) Gene as he used the cup like a â€˜Mandible Clawâ€™ to pin the â€œDirty Dogâ€ for the win.

This match was always going to deliver as both wrestlers know how to work a crowd and it didnâ€™t disappoint.

Itâ€™s MAIN EVENT time!

Liam Slater (c) vs Joe Hendry

Two of the absolute best went one-on-one in the Main Event as Liam Slater defended his North Wrestling Championship against IMPACT WRESTLINGâ€™s newest signing, Joe Hendry and as ever Hendry came with his custom entrance video as it was a play on Lady Gagaâ€™s â€œPoker Faceâ€. The crowd were split down the line for this match as both brought their best, with each man trying to outthink one another. After numerous exchanges, Hendry was able to take control and ground the Champion with a â€˜Cobra Clutchâ€™ until Slater reached deep down inside himself to lead but it didnâ€™t last long as Hendry regained control and momentum until Slater reversed the â€˜Hendry Lockâ€™ into a beautiful â€˜Single Leg Crabâ€™ but Hendry as able to hit a â€˜Superplexâ€™ followed up with a â€˜lariatâ€™ and finally a â€˜Pop-Up Powerbombâ€™ but only for a 2-count. The end came when Slater reversed a â€˜Chokeslamâ€™ attempt into a â€˜Victory Rollâ€™ for the win, retaining his North Wrestling Championship.

This was a fantastic, intense match which saw both showing their respect for each other, a true Main Event match.

Overall â€œThe World At Largeâ€ was a solid show with each match bringing something different to the table and listening to the crowd, they loved it. Good show North!

If you fancy showing your support for the company then donâ€™t forget to join their Patreon https://www.patreon.com/NORTHWrestlingNCL

Plus you can also find them on IWTV https://independentwrestling.tv/

Photo credit goes to Stomp Photography.
